item.title: Dsal | Possession of the new director was held yesterday

The ceremony was chaired by the Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, who expects leaders to “further promote global development of the Macao labor market, protect work rights and interests under the law and build, with new ideas, a harmonious society between employers and workers”. item.title: Elections | José Cesário warns of CTT problems
item.description: José Cesário, Secretary of State for the Portuguese Communities, defended Radio Macau that the usual conditions in the operation of the elections in Portugal, namely the May 18 legislatures, will occur again due to the functioning of the CTT. For José Cesário, these system conditions will affect the electoral participation of the emigrated Portuguese. "The Assembly of the Republic has not produced any kind of legislative change that may be considered in a current electoral process. Therefore, if there is no change, the method will be exactly the same," said the official. In practice, the voter will continue to have to receive the voting report by the mail at the indicated address, then deliver it to the CTT. However, delays in the operation of services or other bureaucracies make it possible to receive the bulletin on time and hours, for example, generating potential increase in abstention. "We are fully aware that there are very varied difficulties in the domain of the functioning of the post office systems in various countries, and this is a difficult matter to overcome," he said. The Secretary of State hopes that the May Legislative Elections can take place "in the best way possible". "Unfortunately, I know very well that there are countries where the post office works will strongly limit electoral participation," he said. The problems are of various order and go through situations where "people, for various reasons, or have changed residence, or not voting in several successive elections, may not receive the vote." The Portuguese again go to elections on May 18 following the lead to the motion of confidence presented by Prime Minister Luís Montenegro, in the Assembly of the Republic, leading to the dissolution of Parliament.

item.title: Real Estate | Room transactions go up. Down prices
item.description:
In February, 176 dwellings were purchased and sold at an average of 76,243 patacas per square meter. Compared to what was happening a year ago, prices suffered a 11.6 percent reduction, but 44 transactions were registered
Last month, the house price reduced 11.6 percent, compared to the same period, to an average of 76,243 patacas per square meter. The information was released by the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). In February last year, the average price of the square meter of housing was 86,225 patacas, 9,982 patacas above the latest amounts released on Monday. However, when the comparison is between January and February this year, the average price of dwellings has a valuation of 6 percent, from 71,917 patacas per square meter to 76,243 patacas per square meter. At the price level, the reality is now different from what was happening in 2019. Before the pandemic, the average price per square meter was 98,618 patacas, which represents a reduction of 22.7 percent, or 22,375 patacas, compared to the data provided on Monday. The information about last month shows that Colaane was the most expensive area in the territory, with an average of 83.5 71 patacas per square meter. In the mud, the average price of the square meter was 82,471 patacas, and on the Macao peninsula of 72,986 patacas. Greater demand The highest price reduction seems to have resulted in an increase in the number of purchases and housing sales. In February, 176 transactions were reported, 44 more than in the same period, when 132 were accounted for, which means growth of one third. When the comparison is made between last month and January, there were 94 transactions, a break of 34.8 percent, from 270 purchases and sales to 176 transactions in February. However, in 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic, the market was more active than currently happens. In February 2019, 279 transactions were registered, 103 more than last month. However, in terms of the volume of transactions, February 2019 numbers approach the January registration this year. The latest data also reveals that the Macao Peninsula was the place with the most transactions, a total of 126 housing purchases and sales. In second place comes the mud with 36 transactions and coloane, where 14 purchases and housing sales were registered.

item.title: Cinema | Announced new guidelines for filming
item.description:
The running over 12 people during the recording of a persecution scene will lead the cultural institute to change instructions to filming teams in the territory. Authorities want to have more information about the recorded plans and scenes
The president of the Cultural Institute (IC), Deland Leong Wai Man, revealed that new guidelines will be issued for filming teams to work in the territory. The information was revealed yesterday, and appears following a road accident in February during the shooting of a movie. According to Deland Leong, the different government departments are currently in communication to last the new plans and instructions. From the moment new filming teams want to come to Macau, the instructions will be distributed and will have to be followed. The new guidelines also predict that production teams have to provide more detailed plans about filming in Macau, with the need to indicate the use of roads, street closure and vehicle driving. From these plans, the authorities will listen to the different departments, such as the Public Security Police Corps and the Traffic Affairs Services Directorate, to ensure that filming take place in a safer and more controlled environment. To the media, Deland Leong Wai Man argued that following this new method, with more detailed information, the cinema industry will have a healthier development, given the current context. Suspended shooting At the same time, the IC official confirmed the maintenance of the suspension order of the film that was the source of an accident with 12 injured, including two 5 and 6 years old children. The accident happened in late February, when a driver lost control of the car while filming a chase scene. Later, the case gained other dimensions when authorities revealed that the chase scene was being filmed by the interior team on the sidelines of the oriented guidelines. About this episode, Leong reported that he is still being discussed, so no conclusions can not be issued. However, the official admitted that the hypothesis of canceling the license to record in Macao is on the table, as the team did not follow the initially issued guidelines. The president of the IC has also been questioned whether the incident can contribute to large productions to avoid the territory. However, Leong dismissed this scenario and pointed out that last year more than 300 outdoor filming teams were in Macao, which said it was the highest number in history. The IC leader also pointed out that Macau is an increasingly attractive destination for movie recording.

item.title: Culture | Miguel de Senna Fernandes distinguished as ambassador
item.description:
The name of Macaense is on a list, with 942 individualities, prepared by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism of China. The ambassador has as its functions the promotion and protection of immaterial cultural heritage
Miguel de Senna Fernandes was distinguished as Ambassador of National Intangible Cultural Heritage. The list of 942 names was announced on Monday night by China's Ministry of Culture and Tourism. Since 2021 the theater in Patuá has been part of China's Intangible Cultural Heritage List. Miguel de Senna Fernandes was chosen as an ambassador for his role in the Dóci Papiaçám group, as well as co-founder is the playwright and director. "I feel very honored and naturally happy. But mainly honored to have been chosen. Now, the responsibility, which was already big, becomes greater," said Senna Fernandes, in statements to HM. "Over these years, I have always had a group of very talented people and this award is theirs. This distinction is not individual, in this kind of things is never an individual work, it is a group work. It was through the group that it was externalized what was created," he added. According to the official statement of the central government, the figure of the ambassador of National Intangible Cultural Heritage has as its functions to ensure the promotion and protection of cultural heritage. In addition to connecting protected cultural manifestations, the statement indicates that people are chosen for presenting “good morals” and “excellent competence” to protect and ensure the transmission of intangible cultural heritage. “The ambassadors of national immaterial cultural heritage are expected to play an exemplary role, actively perform inheritance activities, cultivation successors and contribute more to the protection of immaterial cultural heritage,” was indicated in the statement with new appointments. More guarantees Speaking to HM, Miguel de Senna Fernandes also revealed to see the distinction as a “very important guarantee” for the survival of the theater in Patuá, with the characteristics of the Macaense Theater. "It is a very important guarantee of the survival of theater with all the characteristics that over the years we have been establishing," said the playwright. "When we used to talk to people who did not understand this kind of jokes, humor, we had some reticence. "The Dóci Papiaçá Group has always presented a satirical theater, which aimed at customs, whatever, with social criticism, derision and curse. It is the history of the maricon theater. The Macaense Theater is this. Of course we can do theater in Patuá, but without these characteristics it may not be a maricon theater," he argued. Space for the community Miguel de Senna Fernandes also highlighted the importance of distinction to the community. "It's very good, because at least in this area of ​​culture, the community has a role that is still relevant and this is important," he said. "We are seeing a macao quite different from what it was and in this sea of ​​people, in a kind of culture - the lack of better expression - more monolithic, the theater, the cultural Macaense is relevant is something good for the community and this is important," he said. The next performance of the Dóci Papiaçá Group is scheduled for May 30 and 31, under the 35th of the Macao Arts Festival, with the name Cuza Tá Reni? (What is going on?, In Portuguese). The play will be presented at the large auditorium of the Macao Cultural Center. Macanese does not risk anticipating that the distinction will reflect on a greater impact on the level of public presence. However, it admits that the expectation of the organization of the festival is a full house. Dreams for fulfilling Regarding the future of the theater in Patuá and the Dóci Papiaçám, Senna Fernandes confesses that the “big dream” at this stage is going to return to Portugal to act. The last time the group acted in Portugal was in 1999, even before the transfer of sovereignty from Macau to China. “The dream is to go to Portugal,” he confessed. "It's a matter of money and logistics. Last year, the choir has been to Portugal, but now we want to take the theater and I'm seriously working on it," he said. "The last time the theater went to Portugal was in 1999. And we have never been there! However, Portugal is not the only objective. The co-founder also believes that in the future it will be possible to have an action inside China, although admitting that the molds of this performance, despite the will, are not thought out. Belief and custom Regarding Macao, besides Miguel de Senna Fernandes, the name of Lo Seng Chung, as Ambassador of the belief and customs of Tou Tei. The beliefs of Tou Tei concern one of the best known Chinese gods, also called "Tou Tei Kong", "Foc Tac Cheng San" or "Tai Pak Kong". According to the Cultural Institute, it is "one of the most popular Chinese gods" and regarded by believers "as responsible for matters such as the protection of life, the health and wealth of residents, among other aspects."

item.title: Caeal | Meeting with schools due to subscriptions
item.description:
Allegations that it would have been asked from school teachers managed by associations to collect signatures for the next elections will lead the Electoral Commission to meet with representatives of educational establishments. The commission also received the complaint from an association member who claims to have been required a minimum number of signatures to a list
Complaints from alleged school teachers managed by associations they would have been asked to collect signatures to candidate lists to the next legislative elections, scheduled for September 14, were shared on social networks. After yesterday's meeting of the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal), the president of the entity, Judge Seng Ioi Man, said he will mark meetings with school representatives in early April to share the values ​​of justice, integrity and equality. In general, the official also indicated that the use of coercion or misleading methods to raise signatures is a crime. At a press conference held yesterday, the magistrate said that if the investigation confirms the allegations of the teachers, the forms to constitute candidacies will be considered invalid, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The interference in the electoral process of schools managed by associations with representation in the Legislative Assembly, and funded by the government, has been a constant in previous suffrage, namely with the request for teachers and employees to sign propositions of candidacies and even guardians. For example, in 2021, a teacher at Choi Nong Chi Tai School, linked to the Macao Workers' Associations Federation (Faom), will have appealed to in charge of signing documents from the application committees for legislative elections. In the suffrage of 2017, there were also similar complaints, without repercussions for the lists involved. In the chapter of the repercussions, the president of Caeal was asked yesterday about the possibility that disqualified candidates could or may not submit candidates in these elections, which are the first after the exclusion of five lists and 21 candidates, most of the pro-democracy field, in 2021. Without responding directly to the issue, Seng Ioi Man recalled that, according to the electoral law, who does not support the basic law and not loyal to law. Manda is away from the elections for five years. Track Regarding the suspicions that an elderly woman was invited to sign a candidacy report to legislative elections when exchanging the Macau Pass card to the elderly, the president of Caeal revealed that the case was investigated, but it was not possible to collect concrete information. In addition, Caeal will have received the complaint from an association member who was responsible for collecting a certain number of signatures to a list. Seng Ioi Man has assured that he will follow this case. The official stressed that anyone who helps raise support to form a list for the elections must sign the appointment form and provide assistance voluntarily and clearly. In addition, Caeal's president reiterated that list leaders or campaign organizers cannot resort to coercion, fraud, professional pressure or promises of benefits to influence voters to support a particular list, either through vote or signature to constitute a candidate list. For now, nine CAEAL forms were requested for constitutions of lists for legislative elections, but none have been delivered. The deadline for presenting the application commissions ends on June 6.

item.title: Ruby Hui, President of the Macao Autism Association: “Autism differs from person to person”
item.description:
Created in 2012, the Macao Autism Association continues to fight for more care for children and young people with this development disturbance. But the association's president, Ruby Hui, warns of the need for more incisive policies for adolescents and their specific needs, especially in access to employment
What balance does the work done by the association in recent years? My work is above all to establish a connection with all the entities and resources made available by the government and also the game industry, as the authorities have started to [the context of the new game concession contracts] that develop more social support activities. Therefore, we have gathered all these resources to organize recreational activities for children and youth. In addition, we organize therapy sessions for our members. Usually, we request financial support from private companies and the government, covering 30 to 50 percent of these expenses. The support of the game sector is therefore quite important. Yes, but it has not really been a great support. For example, the government covers part of our monthly expenses, about 40,000 patacas. But this amount comes only to hire two full -time employees and one part -time employee. They are the ones who organize all activities, deal with the bureaucratic part, which includes the presentation of many reports to the government, because we ask for subsidies for almost half of our expenses. Therefore, do you consider that they need more support from the executive to be able to hire more professionals? Yes, it would be ideal. Associations like ours are getting bigger and the children we support are growing. I would say that 60 percent of our members are 11 or more, and about 20 percent are even larger, over 14 years old. We have to think about their future and the needs of therapy and treatment for adolescents, as it is not only small kids who need therapies such as speech or occupational therapy. They are young people who are still in high school and need to acquire different types of social skills, boys need to know how to deal with girls and vice versa. Then, when they become adults, they need to know how to deal with bosses in jobs. There are many valences to explore, but at this moment I would say that the supports are not enough. Are schools not yet prepared to receive these students, for example? Autism may be different from person to person. Students with autism, but who have better learning skills, are in normal schools. But parents tell me that there are not enough teachers with certain skills to deal with and teach these children. There are teachers who still have a very traditional mindset to treat these young people, who often have to deal with alone with bullying, for example. I would say that there are many children and young people with autism with psychological problems because of the school. When it speaks of the traditional mindset, what does this mean in concrete? In the case of my son, for example, he is obliged to always be sitting at school, but often likes to move and get up from his chair. From the point of view of parents who have children with this problem, there would be no problem, as long as it did not bother others, but for teachers it cannot be, and complain. They say things of the genre: "He will beat the table, he will move the painting, makes a lot of noise." Every day I receive complaints from parents to connect with the school, and for small situations like this. What are the main difficulties or challenges that Macao families face when they deal with an autistic child? In my case, my family is middle class, and we are financially well. But when my son was younger needed to do therapy and it was very expensive. Now these therapies cost even more. At the time my son was in primary education, 600 to 700 patacas was paid for each therapy session, but there are days a father told me that the sessions now cost about 1000 patacas per class, which is very expensive. Families of lower social classes cannot afford. Therefore, this support is one of the great objectives of our association, raising money so that we can provide explanations, therapy sessions or other type of support. All so that our members can attend classes with 50 percent discount, where the association pays half the amount. When the association was created, what were its main objectives? In 2012 autism was not a very spoken theme. Therefore, we joined [some parents and families] and we started to ask for support from the government and try to draw attention to the subject. We got some things because the government now gives more support to these young people, at least for those under 12. The problem we feel is that these young people are growing and adolescents need other types of supports that do not exist. What is necessary to change in mindsets and society in relation to autism? In Macao there are not many companies willing to hire young people with autism. Situation that is not seen in Hong Kong, where there are several hiring programs with social companies. Macau needs to follow this path. One day in Rio World Autism Consciousness Day is celebrated on April 2 and, in this context, the Macao Autism Association joined Sands China for a series of activities with children and parents, which took place last March 10th. Through the program “Sands Care”, the game operator provided a visit to the exhibition “Coastal Fantasia”, with the figure of “King Lobster”, a creation of Philip Colbert artist ” A boat trip through the Delta of the Pearl River. In total, 70 people participated. Quoted by a game operator statement, Ruby Hoi said the tour "allowed children to enjoy the maximum of the trip." "Thank you for all the support provided to people with autism in Macau, and I hope that all sectors of society can continue to support the development of these people and promote their inclusion in society," he said. For the game operator, this type of events can help “reinforce the cohesion of families dealing with autism, but also promote the awareness of society and support for the community of people with autism fostering a more inclusive and supportive social environment”.

item.title: FRC | Arte Gongbi, from Zou Li, to be seen until April 5
item.description:
“Burning Like a Lotus” is the name of the new exhibition patent at the Rui Cunha Foundation until April 5th. This is an opportunity to get to know the Gongbi Art Gender, with works by Zou Li. Gongbi Art is known for the extreme detail painting with fine brushes
Since this Tuesday there is a new show to visit in the Rui Cunha Foundation Gallery (FRC). This is “Burning Like a Lotus”, by artist Zou Li, which is an example of the Gongbi art genre, characterized by the use of the traditional thin and delicate brush technique, about Japanese rice role, silk fabric or oriental silk fans. Zou Li is considered "a renowned painter with more than fifty years of career and experience, whose artistic focus is mostly around themes related to the history of Chinese women." The three dozen works now exhibited at the HRF were held between 1997 and 2022. In the artist's work there is a “awareness of femininity through his extraordinary artistic expression”, being present in the creations “harmonious and moving of the beauty of the body and soul of women”, according to a FRC note, Ung Si Meng, honorary president of the Association for Friendship and Coordination of former Macao's Chinese Popular Advisory Conference. It is also described that "for a long time, and to fulfill his social responsibilities and his vocation as a professional painter, Zou Li actively participated in several important historical creations." It is the scroll roll entitled “Imperatriz Wu Zetian” or the “Hundred Chinese Concubin Images” collection. Ung Si Meng also described Zou Li as "widely recognized and appreciated by experts, academics, colleagues and the Chinese artistic society." Large Also according to the same note, it refers that Zou Li's works “reflect the dimension of his academic and artistic knowledge, which have already attracted the wide attention of national and international artistic circles”. In addition, "his works have been much appreciated by art galleries, museums, art institutions, public and private, and collectors." Zou Li has created, throughout his career, more than a thousand works, as well as more than fifty individual exhibitions, in his country and abroad, having also published more than ten individual art catalogs. Recently, in April 2024, the National Museum of Women and Children of China acquired a collection of 593 of his pieces. Zou Li is a member of the China Artists Association, a researcher at the Wenshi Research Hall of the Guangdong Popular Government, director of the Guangdong Province Institute of Chinese Painting and honorary president of the Foshan Artists Association. In the past, he performed the functions of deputy director of the southern branch of the China Central and History Institute of Culture and History, where he also did research work.

item.title: Trump says Chinese president visits Washington in a “not too distant future”
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Monday that his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping will visit Washington in a "not too distant future" in the face of the growing commercial tensions between the world's two largest economies due to the imposition of tariffs. "This will happen in the not too distant future," Trump said to journalists during a meeting of the new Kennedy Center board, a famous cultural center of the capital Washington. The US head of state also noted that senior Chinese government officials, “below” XI, will soon visit the US capital, although it has not advanced names or details about possible dates. Trump mentioned Xi's visit when he said he received visits from foreign leaders in the White House in recent weeks and asked them how Washington was. The Republican stressed that he is “cleaning Washington”, including trying to clean tents used by homeless and graphitis. Last week the US media had reported that Washington and Beijing began discussions about a summit between the leaders of both countries in June. The Chinese press had already suggested the possibility of a meeting in April. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: José Cesário, Secretary of State for the Portuguese Communities, defended Radio Macau that the usual conditions in the operation of the elections in Portugal, namely the May 18 legislatures, will occur again due to the functioning of the CTT. For José Cesário, these system conditions will affect the electoral participation of the emigrated Portuguese. "The Assembly of the Republic has not produced any kind of legislative change that may be considered in a current electoral process. Therefore, if there is no change, the method will be exactly the same," said the official. In practice, the voter will continue to have to receive the voting report by the mail at the indicated address, then deliver it to the CTT. However, delays in the operation of services or other bureaucracies make it possible to receive the bulletin on time and hours, for example, generating potential increase in abstention. "We are fully aware that there are very varied difficulties in the domain of the functioning of the post office systems in various countries, and this is a difficult matter to overcome," he said. The Secretary of State hopes that the May Legislative Elections can take place "in the best way possible". "Unfortunately, I know very well that there are countries where the post office works will strongly limit electoral participation," he said. The problems are of various order and go through situations where "people, for various reasons, or have changed residence, or not voting in several successive elections, may not receive the vote." The Portuguese again go to elections on May 18 following the lead to the motion of confidence presented by Prime Minister Luís Montenegro, in the Assembly of the Republic, leading to the dissolution of Parliament.

item.title: IC | Launched book on the historical roots of Rua das Estlagês
item.description:
“In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Street of Estalagins” is the name of the work Bilingual, launched in digital format, which tells the story of this historic street of Macao, revealing the business that survived the passage of time. Production was in charge of the Macao Artists Society, with the support of the Cultural Institute and Sands China
The history serpes through the stalage street since the end of the nineteenth century. The narrow artery has always been the scene of an intense social and commercial rebolement and it was where Sun Yat-Sen, considered the father of modern China and the Republican Revolution, opened pharmacies and drugstores, especially from 1893. Over the years, Rua das Estalagem, in Porto, was a living example of commerce, and the Portuguese governors were progressively expanding the street, composed of the street Chinese -style buildings and temples, such as the Temple of the Bazaar and Goddess Temple NOVA WO. All these pieces of history are now counting on the digital publication “In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Rua das Estlagês”, a work produced by the Society of Macao Artists and authored by Siguo Chen in Shirley Lule's texts and illustrations. Those responsible for the edition are the Cultural Institute (IC) and the game operator Sands China. According to a press release of Sands China, the book, in Chinese and English, intends to “highlight the fascinating past of the historic Macau Street and the beauty of its legacy”, containing interviews with street -related figures, whether merchants or residents. Thus, it is intended to bring “residents and visitors to rediscover the preciousness of the centenary stores and the cultural heritage of the street through legendary stories” so that they can “widen their understanding of the transformation of the neighborhood and its inhabitants”. The content of the book results from “close conversations with representatives of associations, business entities and residents of the neighborhood,” having dozens of oral stories that can easily be lost if not recorded. This work is not closed in the digital world, having been printed to appear in the public libraries of Macao and schools, in order to “promote the meaning of cultural heritage and enhance mutual ties among the people of Macao”, intending to be “a valuable community resource to deepen the understanding and appreciation of Macao and the street”. 200 years of history One of the highlights given in the book is to the textile sector that has always predominated on Rua das Estlagenas. In the chapter entitled "Two Centuries of Prosperity: Spinning A Legacy in the Textiles Trade" [two centuries of prosperity: the construction of a legacy in the textile trade], it is read that "Street of Estlagins has always been a center for the textile industry." In the years when the textile sector had a larger presence in the territory, between the 70's and 90's, "Rua housed more than 20 stores with factory products, including three spaces from the Veng On Farm Store." “Around 30 businesses related to these stores, such as tailors, clothing stores, western products and funeral ornament stores, which brought a reputation to the street,” he reads. In Rua das Estlagenas “Tissue trade is over 200 years old,” says the same text. Other chapters of the book speak of the presence of the republican revolutionary in Macao in “The Starting Point of Sun Yat-Sen’s Story” [The Starting Point of the story of Sun Yat-Sen] or stories of street-linked personalities and their commerce. In the conclusion of the work, it refers that after the transition, the street "faced new challenges: the global financial crisis, the SARS epidemic, the COVID-19, and the uncertainty of the economy, leaving the need for renewal again." “In the past, the business has flourished, by themselves, thanks to hard work and resilience. But nowadays the community joins with a shared view, planning in an active way [the development of the street] with the support of the Macao government and the integrated resort companies. Institutional view IC President Deland Leong Wai Man pointed out that the book results from the “weighted effort to widen the discussion around preservation and revitalization [of the street],” according to the same press release. "Street renewal is expected to inspire more people to learn about the historic neighborhoods of Macao and participate in their preservation, combining ideas and resources to ensure that the city's culture and history continue to prosper during generations," he said. In turn, Wilfred Wong, CEO of Sands China, argued that "Street of Estalagues is a microcosm of Macao itself, a place where a rich story meets a modern future." "The walls of their alleys witnessed the transformation of Macao, and their stories and people deserve to be remembered, as they are precious sources of the Macao cultural heritage. Our effort to publish the book was possible thanks to the collaboration of our local team to conduct interviews with owners of historical stores, create illustrations and photographs, among other works," he said. New facades It is recalled that this publication arises after the Government was announced by the Sands performance at the Rua das Estalagens Revitalization Plan, namely with the “Entrepreneurs Recruitment Program for Rua das Estlagês”, launched in April last year. The game operator explains that the seven businesses selected for the initiative “have been opening through phases, bringing energy to the zone along with other new businesses, providing a platform for young ambitious entrepreneurs to realize their dreams”. In addition, the game operator intends to revitalize stores' façades “with drawings that enhance their characteristics, resonating the history of the street and the city”. For this initiative, Sands has also collaborated with the Macao Artist Society, and the drawings will be created by two young local artists, Chek On Law and Sit Kat Kit. "The aim is that, with a collective effort like this, the community can rediscover the history of the street and learn about its past stories and stores through the visual interpretations of these local artists from Macao and their perceptions of the territory," he reads. Siguo Chen, the book's author, is a veteran journalist with a career of over 60 years who has been deeply linked to the media area in Macau and Hong Kong.

item.title: Sun Yat-Sen | Marked centenary of the death of the “father of modern China”
item.description:
Sun Yat-Sen died on March 12, 1925. Unavoidable figure in the political history of modern China and the father of the movement that led to the fall of the imperial regime, Sun Yat-Sen was celebrated yesterday in Guangzhou, where he was born, Beijing and Taiwan
The first president of China post-imperial and considered the father of the country's modern era, Sun Yat-Sen, was remembered yesterday in mainland China and Taiwan, the 100th anniversary of his death. In Beijing, there was a “brief and solemn ceremony” of honor to Sun in Beijing Park that has its name. Authorities and “people from all the sectors of society” were present, kept silence and made three venias in front of their statue, the Xinhua official news agency said. The Chinese Academy of History praised the political figure in his Weibo account, describing him as "a great national hero, a great patriot and a major precursor of the Democratic Revolution of China." The city of Guangzhou, the capital of Guangdong Province, where Sun Yat-Sen was born, inaugurated on Tuesday an exhibition of old objects related to the man who was one of the promoters of the revolution that overthrew the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911). The Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Building in the city welcomed the first performance of a musical based on the revolutionary's youth. In Guangzhou, where there is also a university named Sun Yat-Sen, this exhibition is exhibited, which includes objects such as the Sun Yat-Sen Graduation Exam report at the College of Medicine for Chinese, in Hong Kong, from 1892. The certificate of marriage between Sun Yat-Sen and Soong Ching-Ling is also highlighted in 1915, a woman later, woman later, Vice-President of China during the government of Mao Tse-Tung, embracing communism. In the same exhibition you can also see the bronze bust of Sun Yat-Sem itself, made by order of the Japanese friend Umeya Shokichi in 1929. The "father" of modern China was also remembered in Taiwan, with a ceremony by the Sun Yat-sen memorial in Taipei, where flowers were deposited and express respect. Double memories Despite founding, in 1919, the Kuomitang, which would become the main rival of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), Sun is remembered in both mainland China and Taiwan. The Board of State's Taiwan Cabinet stated that Sun Yat-Sen “sought China's national unity and revitalization throughout his life,” appealing at the same time to the “compatriots of Taiwan to join us in the inheritance of his legacy” and to “oppose secession” of the island. Born in 1866, Sun studied medicine in Hong Kong - then a British colony - and, after leading several revolts, gained notoriety as a revolutionary leader and as a driving force of an attempt to modernize the country. In 1911, the Xinhai Revolution led to the fall of the Qing and Sun Yat-Sen dynasty was appointed provisional president of the New Republic of China in January 1912, but quickly gave power to the country's main military leader, Yuan Shikai, who, far from consolidating republican ideals, dissolved the parliament in 1914 and proclaimed herself in 1915, annulling Grande, annul Part of the democratic progress by which Sun had fought. From then on, he continued to promote his ideal of a unified and republican China, reorganizing the KMT and seeking international support for his cause. In 1923, he established an alliance with the newly founded CCP and received the support of the Soviet Union to reinforce the political movement. However, he failed to consolidate a stable government before his death in 1925. A LIFE OF FIGHT In the work “Sisters Soong-the oldest, younger and redest,” by Jung Chang, some details of Sun Yat-Sen's life are described before embracing the revolutionary cause and the way he left his parents' house in Guangzhou, looking for a better life. The place of destination was Hawaii, which on July 4, 1894 declared itself as a Republic, an event that, according to the book, "helped shape today's China." “A 27-year-old radical Chinese, Sun Yat-sen, landed in the archipelago and entered a world where the word 'republic' was in every mouth,” he is described. In China, the agitation against the power of the empire became strong. The Republic "was a new concept," for "the monarchy was the only political system that China knew." "At the time, the country was governed by the Manchu dynasty," the Manchus "were not natural from China, but they had conquered the territory in the mid -seventeenth century." "Since they did not get more than one percent of the population, they were considered a minority of foreign rulers and had never been lacking opposition from the native rebels Han. Sun was one of them," he describes in the same work. Sun Yat-Sen was "a low, dark man with well-proposed and pleasant traits." Its home village, Cuiheng, had soils inappropriate for agriculture, which provided “a life of extreme misery” to those who lived there. As such, the revolutionary's family did not escape adverse conditions. In his first escape from the context of poverty, Sun went to Hong Kong, finding shelter to the diocesan school and boys orphanage, then accepted a marriage arranged by the family as a gimmick to return to the village. Sun Yat-Sen married Mu-Zhen, had children, but was an absent figure and something carefree in the face of family responsibilities, traveling the world to seek support for the revolution he wanted for China. A obra de Jung Chang descreve como o percurso de Sun se ligou ao pai das “três irmãs”, Ei-ling, May-ling e Ching-ling. Charlie Soong funded and supported Sun Yat-Sen in her revolutionary causes, one of her daughters, Ei-Ling, became the republican secretary. This, although married, had made attempts to approach loving and EI-Ling, but eventually had a relationship with Ching-Ling, who was nationalist, but later embraced communism, being known as the "red sister." Ching-ling was also known as the Madame Sun Yat-Sen, but at the time of Sun Yat-Sen's death, the relationship between them had cooled. After the establishment of the Popular Republic of China, Ching-Ling was vice president of the country, between 1949 and 1954, and then between 1959 and 1975, and was vice president of the Permanent Commission of the National Assembly. Passage through macau Moreover, Sun Yat-Sen's life crossed Macao several times, where he lived a short time, unlike his woman, Mu-Zhen, and the children who remained in the territory longer. To remember the short period in which the Republican lived in the territory, at the time under Portuguese administration, the memorial house of dr. Another interesting detail of the 1911 Republican Revolution is the proximity of dates against the establishment of the Republic in Portugal, which took place on October 5, 1910.
